alert.note: Alert for Essex; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 10:01AM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Passaic and Essex Counties. For the Passaic River...including Little Falls...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Little Falls. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, The lower end of East-Holsman Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 6.0 feet, Portions of Hoffman Grove in Wayne sustain some nuisance flooding. At 6.5 feet, Low lying areas in the vicinity of Two Bridges in Wayne are flooded. The lower end of Bergen Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins in Lincoln Park, Wayne and Little Falls. At 8.0 feet, Flooding occurs in the "Old" Wayne area of Wayne. The recycling center and Wagaraw Road ball field complex in Hawthorne begins to experience flooding. At 8.5 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in Fairfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Sunday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening and continue falling to 6.7 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 09/27/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Passaic River Little Falls 7.0 8.9 Sun 9 am 8.5 7.6 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
